tabs.title: Scenario
tabs.content:
**AltaVista Sports** operates a B2B software platform that connects ski resorts with equipment suppliers. The company has two business divisions with separate Azure infrastructure:

| Division | Azure Subscription | Microsoft Entra ID Tenant |
|----------|-------------------|---------------------------|
| North | Sub-North | alta-north.com |
| South | Sub-South | alta-south.com |

Sub-North contains an Azure App Service web application named SupplierPortal. SupplierPortal currently uses Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD) for single-tenant authentication.

Users from alta-north.com can authenticate to SupplierPortal. The company needs to enable users from the alta-south.com tenant to also access SupplierPortal without creating duplicate accounts.

**Requirements:**
- External tenant users must be able to authenticate to SupplierPortal
- The solution should support governed access with approval workflows
- API access between web apps and backend services must be secured
- JWT tokens must be validated at the API gateway level

What changes should you recommend to enable cross-tenant authentication?
